summary: In this context, Buta-1,3-diene and Butadiene are essentially the same compound, with Buta-1,3-diene being a systematic name for Butadiene. The discussion focuses on the environmental exposure to Butadiene (BD) as an air contaminant, particularly in relation to cigarette smoke and urban pollution, highlighting its potential health risks, including an increased lifetime risk of leukemia. The terms are used interchangeably, emphasizing their direct chemical relationship.
